reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first time in Rome and we booked through a site that reserved plane, hotel, train tickets, and transfers for a 9-day tour of Rome, Florence, and Venice. This hotel was located near the tram that takes you directly to the Piazza Popolo, and from there you can get anywhere in Rome, either on foot or by subway. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was neat, clean and adequate in size. In the summer it would have been wonderful to use the large patio with table and chairs outside the French doors of our room. The bed was very hard, and the pillows very flat. The breakfast was fine, but no hot choices such as eggs, etc.
reviews.title: Very quiet and private, authentic Rome neighborhood. . .

likes.disliked: — hard bed and flat pillow, cold coffe in breakfast room, no nearby markets

reviews.text: We would have liked more places to eat in the immediate neighborhood for convenience. the two restaurants nearby were open/closed at their own convenience, and there were no markets open close by either. Overall we liked the hotel, but not sure if we would choose it again.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

likes.disliked: — Location double edged sword and it did require transportation to sights.

reviews.title: Lovely Hotel
reviews.text: Since this was our first time to Rome, we didn't understand how important location is. Villa Glori is a bit away from the center of Rome and its accompanying noise and traffic. It is small and lovely, and most of all, quiet! If you would like a respite from the crazy crowds and traffic, this could be it. Rooms are very clean and the staff very friendly. The only problem we had in this hotel and two others in Italy was in receiving poor directions! My advice would be to get a really good map and make sure you know where you are going and how you will get there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed four nights at the Villa Glori before carrying on to Sorrento. It was a lovely hotel, although our room (211) was very small, not much room at all to hang up clothes. But it was very clean and the breakfast was adequate, just continental. It was a bit of a way out of the centre of Rome. We walked everywhere, but at the end of the day we just got on the No. 2 tram at Popolo/Flaminio for 3 or 4 stops. The hotel reception staff were very nice, except one girl who was a bit miserable, and not very polite. We ate at a couple of typically Italian resturants, very close to the hotel, which were lovely, and probably much cheaper than in the centre. All in all, we loved our stay, and would recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was a sigh of relief after a long trip. It was clean, well kept and the staff was VERY friendly. There was even an enclosed shower (the first on our trip!) which was great. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and they even had CNN (after 2 weeks it was nice to hear some English and see what was going on at home). This hotel is somewhat off the beaten path it was nice to get away from the hustle of the big city. It was very easy to walk to the tram (an above ground trolley - similar to the green line in Boston) and in 5 minutes you were into the main city. From there is was easy to walk or take the subway anywhere you wanted to go. I was definitely stay here again. On a side note - i do NOT recommend the bus tour they use (Green line). We took their Rome by Night tour and it was terrible. Half of it was before the sun even went down, the tour guide was terrible and the bus drive was so crazy I thought we were going to crash!
reviews.title: Good value, good hotel a short tram ride out of town.

reviews.text: I was informed at the last minute that I would be travelling to Rome for work. Keeping in mind that I had never left the North American Continent and that work decided NOT to spend top dollar on me I was unsure what to expect in Villa Glori. The website is a little misleading with lots of pictures of what seem to be large rooms. WRONG- they are mostly pictures of the common areas and the dining room- which are much smaller in real life. Now, this is not unusual for in Europe space is elusive and even if you have Donald Trump money you will still most likely have to suck in your gut when entering a room!
reviews.title: When out of Rome- do as the Romans!

reviews.text: Villa Glori is outside of the downtown, Vatican, tourist area. It is nicely settle in the middle of a Roman neighborhood. That means that it is high density all around The Hotel has something in the neighbor hood of two parking spaces so unless you want to fight the locals for a spot (and they have the edge in this battle) I would take a cab. The desk will gladly call a cab service for you and they are very friendly. The English is so-so, but since Rome is an international city it is possible to get aropund with any of the top 4 languages- even at Villa Glori. There is an elevator, though tiny (maybe two skinny adults fit) it is also extremely quiet. If you get a room by the elevator do not be concerned because you will not hear it. The hotel has less than 50 rooms and the desk will require that you leave the room key with them as you leave for the day. thats just fine because very room key has a large metal plate on it. The plate is used as an electrical key in your room. You slide it in a slot to get the power to turn on. Trust me- you will not want to put the key in your pocket.
reviews.title: Perfect Base From Which To See Rome And At A Sensible Price

likes.disliked: — Poor breakfast coffee; noise from other guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are typical European with twin beds unless you specifically book something else. The Tv's are flat panel HD but only CNN international is in English. That's should be fine because when in Rome...you shouldn't be watching too much TV! The decor is modern and the bathrooms are newly renovated complete with towel warmers! Seriously, the bathrooms are spacious, and the showers are comfy for all but the widest Americans.
reviews.title: Best Hotel In Roma!!!!

likes.disliked: — Actually trying to find something wrong with the hotel.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is traditional Italian continental. Sliced meats, hard boiled eggs, and plenty of breads. The hotel does only breakfast as they do not have a full blown kitchen. Cereal, milk, sparkling water and fresh juice is also part of the free meal. Since the hotel is in the middle of a nice residential area there are a few restaurants within walking distance.
reviews.title: A fantastic hotel

likes.liked: — The quiet peaceful neighbourhood, the decor and cleanliness.

reviews.title: Wonderful Villa Glori
reviews.text: During the day there is plenty of activity, but come evening it slows down to a trickle. Keep in mind that Italians eat pretty late so evening is longer than you might expect, but at night the streets are quiet. I would not walk around too late as the area, like most places in the world, has some scary dark alleys.

This is a really really nice hotel. Upon checkin, the staff told us about attractions we might be interested in, gave us a map and directions to everything, just outstanding. We were 2 girls traveling together, and they gave us our own rooms across the hall from each other for no extra charge. I'm sure they just had more demand for the doubles for couples, but believe me, nothing preserves a female friendship more solidly than separate spaces, so we were thrilled.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.text: The single rooms we were put in where small but very nice. They included a safe which I did use, and the bathrooms were wonderful -- no leaking, very clean, very posh even.
reviews.title: Great place if u wanna come back to the room in 11pm
Over Booked?
reviews.text: Using google maps to find this hotel (we took the metro to bus #2) misled me into thinking that the small alley this hotel is on went through to Via Flaminia. It does not. You will have to walk up Viale del Vignola and take a right.
I would absolutely in a heart beat stay here again.
reviews.title: Quiet neighborhood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in the Vila glory in the winter, where everything is closed by 11pm so it was a good choice. The hotel is in great shape, clean and the service and breakfast r good. the problem is that u need to take a tram ride (5-10 minutes, tram No 2), to reach "Piaza del popolo" (M. Flaminio), which is near the city center. anyway, the hotel is awsome but i would not recommend if for summertime when u would want to go late at night.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location

reviews.text: This room was so small my knees hit the closet when I sit on the end of the bed. I was able to keep all my luggage (and I had alot) in the closet to keep the walk area clear though. I had to carry my large and heavy bags over a stair way to get to my room. The bathroom was decent sized and nice and clean. The bed was hard as a rock but I was able to sleep anyway. There are two wafer thin pillows so if you want to sit in bed you better have your own pillow. The neighborhood looked a little questionable, but after tooling around Rome for a couple of days I found it was average. The taxis will charge something different everytime you use them even from the same destintion. I didnt have enough time to figure out the public transportation. The front desk is very friendly and got us a good deal to the airport. Breakfast was a good selection of foods for all travelers.
reviews.title: Small small small but clean and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is not at the central of Roma. You will need to take a 8-10 mins tram from the nearest subway Flaminio, then a less than 5 mins walk from the tram station back to the hotel. From Flaminio stn, you are already at the Piazza Del Popolo - and a 15 mins walk will lead you to Spanish Steps! The hotel is clean & nice, room is small as a standard in Europe. Good breakfast & lovely freshly made crossiants! Staffs are generally very helpful. Overall, a very good hotel with value!
reviews.title: Nice hotel with value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked through an internet consolidator and got a wonderful price (less than 100 euros/night) on this clean, comfortable hotel. It is outside the hustle of the center, but only 1/2 block from a tram that takes you directly to the Flaminio Metro station. Getting from the hotel to the sights of Rome was easy. There are several good restaurants in the neighborhood. It's primarily residential and safe to walk around in the evenings.
reviews.title: Far enough from the center to be peaceful, but easy access to all the sights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is Continental, but room service for breakfast is available with American-style breakfasts for an extra charge.
reviews.title: Great location, but with out the hassle and bussle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean and comfortable but (like many places in Europe), very small. The shower in our room would be uncomfortable for a large or very overweight person. The reception desk is open 24 hours a day, with friendly and multilingual staff.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!
